title: Alesha Dixon
summary: Alesha Anjanette Dixon (born 7 October 1978)[3] is an English singer, rapper, dancer, television personality, and author. She rose to fame in the early 2000s as a member of the R&B, garage, and hip hop trio Mis-Teeq. The group disbanded in 2005 and Dixon then pursued a music career as a solo artist, signing a recording contract with Polydor Records. She recorded her debut solo studio album, Fired Up in 2005, releasing her debut single "Lipstick", followed by "Knockdown", after which her popularity as a singer had declined, and was subsequently dropped from Polydor.[4]
